source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Pomaderris
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Pomaderris. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Adult leaves to 15 mm long, glabrous or hispid adaxially; inflorescences mostly of axillary clusters, c. subequal to the subtending leaves; sepals 1.5–2 mm long; north-central and north-western areas
Adult leaves 15 mm long or more, always glabrous on upper surface; inflorescences narrow, interrupted, usually both terminal and axillary; sepals 2–2.5 mm long; coastal and near-coastal
